meanings.definition: Make a long, high-pitched cry or noise.
meanings.sent1: The excited puppy was squealing with joy when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent2: The brakes on the old car were squealing loudly as it came to a stop.
meanings.sent3: The children were squealing in delight as they played in the park.
meanings.sent4: The kettle was squealing like a tea-loving banshee on the stove.
meanings.sent5: The squealing tires echoed through the empty parking lot.

meanings.definition: A long, high-pitched cry or noise.
meanings.sent1: The loud squealing of the pig could be heard from the farm.
meanings.sent2: The squealing of the brakes made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character let out a comical squealing sound when surprised.
meanings.sent4: The squealing of the microphone feedback was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The high-pitched squealing of the teapot signaled it was ready.
